title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.57 - Executive Order No. 57: Placing requirement on Attorney General in relation to certain crimes committed by public servants in the County of Queens. [DAGGER]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.57 - Executive Order No. 57: Placing requirement on Attorney General in relation to certain crimes committed by public servants in the County of Queens. [DAGGER]
State Regulations

Executive Order No. 57.01*
Executive Order No. 57.02
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF
THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... Article I of my order and requirement to you, embodied in

Executive Order Number fifty-seven dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred
seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (c) thereof to be
subdivision (d) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be subdivision (c), to read as follows: " (c) without limiting the foregoing provisions, any and
all acts and omissions and alleged acts and omissions by any person occurring
heretofore or hereafter in the County of Queens in violation of any provision
of State or local law and arising out of, relating to or in any way connected
with the receipt, possession, or disposal of dangerous drugs by the Police

Department of the City of New York, its officers, employees, or agents;"
Signed: Nelson A. Rockefeller

Dated: December 28, 1972

Executive Order No. 57.03
*
Executive Order No. 57.04
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF
THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... WHEREAS, on the nineteenth day of September, one thousand
nine hundred seventy-two, I made a requirement upon you, embodied in Executive

Order Number fifty-seven, in relation to the County of Queens, New York; and
WHEREAS, on the twenty-third day of May, one thousand nine
hundred seventy-three, the term of the District Attorney of Queens County
expired; and
WHEREAS, on the twenty-fourth day of May, one thousand nine
hundred seventy-three, the term of the newly appointed District Attorney of

Queens County commenced; NOW, THEREFORE, I do hereby reaffirm and continue my order
and requirement upon you, embodied in Executive Order Number fifty-seven and
dated the nineteenth day of September, one thousand nine hundred seventy-two, as heretofore and hereafter amended; effective the twenty-fourth day of May, one thousand nine hundred seventy-three. Signed: Nelson A. Rockefeller

Dated: July 13, 1973

Executive Order No. 57.05
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF
THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK 1222......................................................................................................................... WHEREAS, on the nineteenth day of September, one thousand
nine hundred seventy-two, Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller made a requirement
upon you, embodied in Executive Order Number 57, in relation to the County of

Queens, New York; and
WHEREAS, on the eighteenth day of December, one thousand
nine hundred seventy-three, I issued Executive Order Number 1, continuing the
validity and effectiveness of executive orders theretofore issued by the

Governors of the State of New York; and
WHEREAS, on the thirty-first day of December, one thousand
nine hundred seventy-three, the term of the District Attorney of Queens County
expired; and
WHEREAS, on the first day of January, one thousand nine
hundred seventy-four, the term of the newly elected District Attorney of Queens

County commenced; NOW, THEREFORE, I do hereby reaffirm and continue the order
and requirement upon you, embodied in Executive Order Number 57 and dated the
nineteenth day of September, one thousand nine hundred seventy-two, as
heretofore and hereafter amended, effective the first day of January one
thousand nine hundred seventy-four. Signed: Malcolm A. Wilson

Dated: February 19, 1974

Executive Order No. 57.06
*
Executive Order No. 57.07*
Executive Order No. 57.08 TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITAL ALBANY, NEW
YORK......................................................................................................................... In view of the written requests of your deputy, Special

State Prosecutor John F. Keenan, and the District Attorney of Queens County, Nicholas Ferraro, Article I of the order and requirement to you, embodied in

Executive Order Number fifty-seven dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred
seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (d) thereof to be
subdivision (e) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be subdivision (d), to read as follows: (d) The following criminal proceedings: People
v. John Doe, Special Prosecutor Index Number Q-65/1973; and

People
v. John Doe, Special Prosecutor Index Number Q-146/1976; Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: October 6, 1976

Executive Order No. 57.09
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF
THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK 12224......................................................................................................................... WHEREAS, on the nineteenth day of September, one thousand
nine hundred seventy-two, Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller made a requirement
upon you, embodied in Executive Order Number 57, in relation to the County of

Queens, which requirement has been continued and amended on various occasions; and
WHEREAS, on the thirty-first day of December, nineteen
hundred seventy-six, the District Attorney of Queens County resigned; and
WHEREAS, on the first day of January, one thousand nine
hundred seventy-seven, the term of the newly appointed District Attorney of

Queens County commenced; NOW THEREFORE, I do hereby reaffirm and continue the order
and requirement upon you, embodied in Executive Order Number 57, and dated the
nineteenth day of September, nineteen hundred seventy-two, as heretofore and
hereafter amended. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: January 27, 1977

Executive Order No. 57.10 TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW
YORK......................................................................................................................... In view of the request of Special Deputy Attorney General

John F. Keenan, and with the consent of the District Attorney of Queens County, John J. Santucci, Article I of the order and requirement to you, embodied in

Executive Order Number 57 dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred
seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (e) thereof to be
subdivision (f) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be subdivision (e), to read as follows: (e) Any and all unlawful acts or omissions or alleged
unlawful acts or omissions by any person arising out of, relating to or in any
way connected with the subject matter of an investigation presently pending in
the Office of the Special Prosecutor, entitled: People
v. John Doe, Special Prosecutor Index Number Q-146A/76; Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: February 27, 1977

Executive Order No. 57.11
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF
THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... In view of the request of Special Deputy Attorney General

John F. Keenan, and the consent of the District Attorney of Queens County, John
J. Santucci, Article I of the order and requirement to you, embodied in

Executive Order Number 57 dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred
seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (f) thereof to be
subdivision (g) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be subdivision (f), to read as follows: (f) Any and all unlawful acts or omissions or alleged
unlawful acts or omissions by any person arising out of, relating to or in any
way connected with the subject matter of an investigation presently pending in
the Office of the Special Prosecutor, entitled: People
v. John Doe, Special Prosecutor Index Number Q-145B/75; Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: June 21, 1977

Executive Order No. 57.22
TO: THE HONORABLE ROBERT ABRAMS ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE
STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... In view of the request of the Special Deputy Attorney

General Thomas A. Duffy, Jr., and the request of District Attorney of Queens

County, John J. Santucci, Article I of the order and requirement to you, embodied in Executive Order Number fifty-seven dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (g)
thereof to be subdivision (h) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be
subdivision (g), to read as follows: (g) Any and all unlawful acts or omissions or alleged
unlawful acts or omissions by any person arising out of, relating to or in any
way connected with the subject matter of an investigation entitled: People
v. Chris Kimos and Carlos

Ramos, Indictment Number 8328-80-Queens. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: March 2, 1982

Executive Order No. 57.23*
Executive Order No. 57.24
TO: THE HONORABLE ROBERT ABRAMS ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE
STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... In view of the request of the Special Deputy Attorney

General Thomas A. Duffy, Jr., and the request of District Attorney of Queens

County, John J. Santucci, Article I of the order and requirement to you, embodied in Executive Order Number fifty-seven dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (h)
thereof to be subdivision (i) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be
subdivision (h), to read as follows: (h) Any and all unlawful acts or omissions or alleged
unlawful acts or omissions by any person arising out of, relating to or in any
way connected with the subject matter of an investigation entitled: People
v. Ulysses

Newson

Indictment Number 595-82 - Queens

Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: June 21, 1982

Executive Order No. 57.25
TO: THE HONORABLE ROBERT ABRAMS ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE
STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... In view of the request of the Special Deputy Attorney

General Thomas A. Duffy, Jr., and the request of District Attorney of Queens

County, John J. Santucci, Article I of the order and requirement to you, embodied in Executive Order Number fifty-seven dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (i)
thereof to be subdivision (j) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be
subdivision (i), to read as follows: (i) Any and all unlawful acts or omissions or alleged
unlawful acts or omissions by any person arising out of, relating to or in any
way connected with the subject matter of an investigation entitled: People
v. Michael

Millwater

Indictment Numbers 284-82 and 8086-82 - Queens

Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: June 21, 1982

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
1.57

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
